page.title: 18OFFLEY GRANGE
page.content: The present house was built in 1906. The original farm was part of the estate of Offley Place.'Grange' suggests it was farmed by the monks for the church.The present farmer has a partnership with his son and the 490 acres of land is rented from the Pilkington family.The farming is mainly beef cattle,500 head,350 sheep, and the rest of the land for crops. The farm produces grass for feeding the cattle and clover,for hay and seed,which is sold.They grows 11 acres of sainfoin,which is also used for hay and seed.This crop has not been grown a lot since 1940,but is making a successful come back.Winter beans, peas and cereals are also grown.They are doing a trial with triticale,which is a cross between rye and wheat.A lot of the cereal is not sold but used for feeding the cattle.
